lead_paragraph: Britain's treasury chief urged wealthy countries yesterday to channel an additional $50 billion a year in financial aid to the world's poorest nations as part of an economic effort that he compared to a global Marshall Plan. The treasury chief, Gordon Brown, Britain's chancellor of the exchequer, said the increased development aid was needed to pay for universal primary education, a two-thirds reduction in infant mortality and a halving of world poverty by 2015.
